Tasks.Task Description: Use Azure Monitor to continuously track the performance metrics of Azure Files, such as latency, throughput, and IOPS. Investigate and resolve any anomalies.
Verify the security settings of Azure Files, including access control lists (ACLs), encryption settings, and shared access signatures (SAS). Ensure compliance with organizational security policies.
Test backup and restore processes for Azure Files to ensure data integrity and availability in case of accidental deletion or corruption.
Review file share usage and storage quotas to ensure optimal utilization and prevent overages. Adjust quotas as necessary.
Review and update security policies for Azure Files, including network security groups (NSGs) and firewall rules, to adapt to changes in the security landscape.
Perform failover tests to verify the resiliency of Azure Files in case of regional outages or service disruptions.
Analyze performance data and implement optimizations, such as tiering or caching, to improve Azure Files performance.
Keep Azure Files documentation up-to-date, including operational procedures, configuration details, and troubleshooting guides.
Audit the configuration of the storage account hosting Azure Files to ensure alignment with best practices and organizational standards.
Conduct incident response drills to prepare the team for potential security incidents or Azure Files outages. Ensure familiarity with procedures and protocols.
Develop and execute plans for Azure Files upgrades or expansions as needed. Ensure minimal disruption during these activities.
Ensure the operations team participates in regular training to stay updated with new Azure Files features, best practices, and security measures.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding Azure Files performance and reliability. Implement continuous improvements based on this feedback.
